newsitem.title: ITALY: Two Italian generals resign over Somalia scandal.
newsitem.headline: Two Italian generals resign over Somalia scandal.

text.p: Two generals who led Italian forces on a peacekeeping mission to Somalia resigned on Saturday over allegations that their troops tortured, sexually abused and killed unarmed Somalis.
The office of the Army Chief of Staff said General Bruno Loi and General Carmine Fiore had asked to be replaced "to ease and speed up the investigations underway" into the allegations.
The Army Chief of Staff "accepted the request in order to contribute with the maximum determination to the rapid clarification of this affair," a statement said.

Graphic reports of alleged abuses in news magazine Panorama spurred the government on Friday to announce a joint civilian and military commission to investigate the claims that Italian troops tortured and abused Somalis during a U.S.-led humanitarian mission in 1992.

Prime Minister Prodi promised swift action to identify culprits in the alleged brutality, which included purported sexual violence against a Somali woman and allegations that Italian soldiers killed unarmed civilians.

President Oscar Luigi Scalfaro has also called a meeting next Wednesday of Italy's Supreme Defence Council, a body rarely meets, to hear a report from defence chief Admiral Guido Venturoni on international missions by Italy's armed forces.
